overview: The project has been transformed into a web-based USMLE Step 1 study companion named AorteQ, featuring a comprehensive authentication system, a three-step study plan setup wizard, a question bank interface, and a progress tracking dashboard, all designed with a clean and professional aesthetic.
key_events: Introduction of a new authentication system with a login page.
Implementation of a three-step wizard for initial study plan setup.
Development of a question bank interface and session analysis dashboard.
Creation of a progress tracking dashboard to monitor user performance.
user_requests: Transform the existing application into a web-based study companion with essential features.
system_responses: Refactored the application architecture to modularize components for authentication, study planning, question bank, and progress tracking.
Updated UI components to align with new branding and layout requirements.
Implemented new methods for user authentication and study plan generation.
current_state: The application now operates with a modular architecture, enhancing maintainability and scalability. User authentication is required for accessing study features, improving security. The new design adheres to responsive web standards and provides a user-friendly interface for studying.
